results.headline: Review: ‘Infinitely Polar Bear’ Traces a Dad’s Ups and Downs
results.summary_short: This debut feature from the writer-director Maya Forbes concerns a family whose father (Mark Ruffalo) has manic depression, as seen by his young daughter.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Infinitely Polar Bear

results.display_title: Hippocrates: Diary of a French Doctor
results.headline: Review: ‘Hippocrates’ Offers Life, Death and Teachable Moments
results.summary_short: This film, subtitled “Diary of a French Doctor,” unfolds pretty much like an average episode of “ER,” though with more French flag waving and less storeroom romancing.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hippocrates: Diary of a French Doctor

results.headline: Review: ‘Gabriel’ Stars Rory Culkin as a Young Man With Mental Illness
results.summary_short: An obsessive and troubled Gabriel leaves a psychiatric hospital and strains the lives of his loving mother and childhood girlfriend in this tense film.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Gabriel

results.headline: Review: ‘Evaporating Borders’ Examines the Immigrant Crisis in Cyprus
results.summary_short: Iva Radivojevic’s diffuse documentary essay records the suffering of Iraqi and Filipino immigrants, as well as the hateful attitude of some native Cypriots.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Evaporating Borders

results.headline: Review: ‘Burying the Ex,’ a Joe Dante Zombie Tale
results.summary_short: A looming breakup doesn’t go as planned in the first feature in six years from the director of the “Gremlins” movies and “The ’Burbs.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Burying the Ex

results.headline: Review: ‘ABCD 2,’ TV Dance Stars Try to Rebuild Their Team and Reputation
results.summary_short: The leader of the Mumbai Stunners troupe hopes to turn around the group’s fortunes in this Remo D’Souza Bollywood sequel.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of ABCD 2 (Anybody Can Dance 2)

results.headline: Review: ‘3 ½ Minutes, Ten Bullets’ Explores a Gas Station Slaying in Florida
results.summary_short: Marc Silver’s documentary about the shooting of Jordan Davis, a black teenager, by a white man coolly explores the multiple perspectives on a lightning-quick altercation and death.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 3 1/2 Minutes, Ten Bullets

results.headline: Review: ‘Dope,’ a Teenage Comedy, Plays With Stereotypes
results.summary_short: In Rick Famuyiwa’s film, Malcolm, a smart student and musician prepping for a Harvard interview, does a favor for a drug dealer and winds up with a gun and a backpack of contraband.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dope

results.headline: Review: ‘Tentacle 8’ Ensnares a Security Analyst in a Maze of Secrets
results.summary_short: John Chi’s movie takes off when a man who is suspected of having a hand in data loss escapes a secret detention center.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tentacle 8

results.headline: Review: ‘The Tribe’ Communicates Without Words
results.summary_short: This Ukrainian film by the director Myroslav Slaboshpytskiy relies on body language — the actors speak using only sign language.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Tribe

results.headline: Review: ‘Hamari Adhuri Kahani’ Tours a Bad Marriage and the Jungle
results.summary_short: Mohit Suri’s melodramatic film finds time amid its globe-trotting adventure to comment on domestic abuse in India.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hamari Adhuri Kahani

results.headline: Review: ‘The Wolfpack’ Shares the Story of Brothers and a Cinematic Lifeline
results.summary_short: Six young men who steeped themselves in film when they were prevented from venturing past their apartment door are the subject of Crystal Moselle’s intimate documentary.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Wolfpack

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Yes Men Are Revolting,’ Prankster Activists Take On Climate Change
results.summary_short: The third documentary follows this comic duo through some personal struggles as they train their sights on global warming.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Yes Men Are Revolting

results.headline: Review: ‘Set Fire to the Stars’ Unleashes Dylan Thomas on America
results.summary_short: The film follows the poet to the United States in an era when the romantic notion that drunkenness was a shortcut to enlightenment held sway.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Set Fire to the Stars

results.headline: Review: ‘Madame Bovary’ Features Mia Wasikowska as a Notorious Adulteress
results.summary_short: This costume-drama adaptation of Flaubert’s “Madame Bovary” stays true to the plot.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Madame Bovary

results.headline: Review: ‘Live From New York!’ Celebrates 40 Years of ‘Saturday Night Live’
results.summary_short: This documentary, directed by Bao Nguyen and part of the Tribeca Film Festival, chronicles that TV comedy show as a cultural institution but fails to explore its inner workings.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Live From New York!

results.headline: Review: In ‘The 11th Hour,’ Fertility Anxiety Gets Thriller Treatment
results.summary_short: A woman desperate to be a mother and a heroin-addicted dwarf journey to Eastern Europe for a baby.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The 11th Hour

results.display_title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl
results.headline: Review: In ‘Me and Earl and the Dying Girl,’ a Comfort Zone That Cannot Last
results.summary_short: Adapted from the young-adult novel, the movie centers on a teenage auteur, his filmmaking colleague and “the dying girl,” who balks at sentimentality.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Me and Earl and the Dying Girl

results.headline: Review: In ‘Jurassic World,’ the Franchise Feeds the Beast
results.summary_short: The latest installment of the Jurassic franchise, set in a luxury resort, reminds you what a great action god Steven Spielberg is.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jurassic World

results.headline: Review: In ‘Chagall-Malevich,’ Two Painters Clash in Revolutionary Russia
results.summary_short: A color-saturated Russian movie looks at Marc Chagall’s tumultuous time leading an art school in Vitebsk, where one of the teachers was Kazimir Malevich.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Chagall - Malevich
